name: Theta Tau (Alpha) UTD Fraternity
description: The purpose of this fraternity shall be to develop and maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship by engaging its members in career-enriching projects and industry connections. Our mission is to provide an affordable professional Greek life where students can be part of a brotherhood that provides career-building, and network opportunities.

name: Nebula Labs
description:
Nebula Labs is an interdisciplinary community consisting of developers and designers that build tools for UT Dallas students like a degree planner and a tool to visualize professor data.

Our purpose is to:
* Create and maintain an interdisciplinary community of learners
* Improve the lives of others by providing a platform that allows students to build and maintain tools for the community
* Provide students opportunities to serve the UT Dallas community through experiential learning
* Host technical and design workshops, teach-ins, and other events for UT Dallas students

Our current projects in development are:
* Planner - An interactive degree planner
* Survival Guide - A wiki filled with information about life at UT Dallas
* Trends - A website that displays course grades, evals, and more
* Jupiter - A portal for everything related to student organizations
* API/Platform - The backend that supports all of our projects

If building real, impactful projects for others appeals to you, please check out our website (https://about.utdnebula.com/) and join our Discord (https://discord.gg/tcpcnfxmeQ)

name: Women Who Compute
description: Women Who Compute is a community for women pursuing careers in engineering and computer science at The University of Texas at Dallas. We aim to provide opportunities for mentorship, personal and professional development, and social bonding with women of paralleled interests in computing. Representing one of the largest women-advocating organizations on campus, Women Who Compute strives to cultivate community, provide mentorship and support, and encourage career exploration.
